body.p: To his excellency the Governor of Kentucky

Your petitioner George W. Burgess States that he is a citizen of Fleming County a farmer residing near the Town of Sherburn, aged about 60 years and in a a feeble state of health & while in such Condition on the 2nd day of June 1865 he was met in the Road by one Wm Bateman and without any just Cause or provocation maliciously assaulted, beaten & Bruised by said Bateman, and, in which assault Bateman was the aggressor.

But he went & sent out a warrant upon which by his ^false^ testimony, he Bateman Caused your petitioner to be fined ^(as the assailant)^ the Sum SixSeven 50/100 Dollars & Costs, which veredict & Judgt was procured by Deft said Bateman Swearing your petitioner run upon & cut him with a Knife, which was false & untrue -- He, Bateman made the assault himself & badly Cut your petitioner. Your petitioner has always been a peaceable & law abiding Citizen -- he moved for a new trial & the Justice overruled the Same -- Wherefore, he prays for the clemency of your excellency in the premises & a remission of of said fine, June 24, 1865.
Sworn to before me by G. W. Burgess this 24. June 1865 --

Fleming Ct Ct
vs
G. W. Burgess

Sherburne Fleming Co
June 24, 1865
To the Governor
Dear Sir

I was present to day fand ^witnessed^ a trial between the Commonwealth and Mr. Wm Bateman for the assault, &c alluded to in the petition of Mr G. W Burgess herewith, and the proof in my opinion clearly exclused Mr Burgess and sustained his petition herewith to your excellency & at his instance I so write this believing he ought not to have been fined, or be Compelled to pay it, that Justice demands a remission of the fine against him as asked for in his petition

yours truly & Respectfully
Wm H, Cord
County Attorney
